intro: Ateleia peltaria, commonly known as the peltate ateleia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. While not widely cultivated, it has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
